subject: RE: Two handouts for 'resources' page

full_threads.body: @ricaV2 Please don't track time of this as it was part of original scope, thank you!

https://littlealliedhealth.com.au/resources/ hi, @chris please check.
also done working with the images under the services menu.

madam @ricaV2  20mins

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Glen Tenorio

full_threads.body:
Hi Rika,

Can you please assist with the below request for https://littlealliedhealth.com.au/resources/ ?

Task: * Add downloadable resources to display as tiles.
* Below is the file and the ‘Title’ for the tile/item.
* There is also a screenshot of the proposed layout.

Prio Low priority.

Download 1: https://littlealliedhealth.com.au/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/Seven-Sounds-FLC-Handout-OCT-2022.pdf
Title: Seven Sounds FLC Handout

Download 2: https://littlealliedhealth.com.au/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/Seven-Sounds-FLC-Keyring-Pictures-OCT-2022.pdf
Title: Seven Sounds FLC Pictures

Download 3: https://littlealliedhealth.com.au/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/Seven-Sounds-FLC-Weekly-Record-OCT-2022.pdf
Title: Seven Sounds Weekly Record

See below 😊


From: Chris Paradowski <chris@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:chris@wolfiq.com.au>>
Sent: Thursday, 27 October 2022 8:27 AM
To: Jenna Bongioletti <Jenna@allearsandspeech.com.au <mailto:Jenna@allearsandspeech.com.au>>
Cc: Nicole Eglinton <nicole@allears.com.au <mailto:nicole@allears.com.au>>
Subject: Re: Two handouts for 'resources' page

Hi Jenna,

Got it. We can create a page to accommodate all the downloads. We’ll display them as tiles.

Are you able to provide the following details?

Title: Resources
an introductory paragraph to explain what your web visitor can expect to have access to
On this page, you’ll find a collection of resources and handy handouts that you can download free. This collection will build over time, so remember to check back regularly to see what’s new!
Category for the resources e.g. hearing resource, speech resources etc.
Broadly, there will be handouts and resources. That will work for now, and as we built it, we can re-consider categories.
Specific titles for the resource e.g. Seven Sounds etc.
Lets call the two you have now ‘Seven Sounds FLC Pictures’ (I think it was just the picture cards – but if it was also the key ring version with square pictures, call it ‘Seven Sounds Key Ring’), and Seven Sounds FLC Handout.


I suggest using the same layout featured on the services pages to keep things looking nice and consistent.

We can use subheadings for the various categories of information, e.g. whether it is related to hearing, speech etc.

Below is a quick screenshot and mark-up of what could work.




Regards,




Chris Paradowski
Partnerships Manager
Wolf IQ Pty Ltd


1300 072 134 <tel:1300%20072%20134> | 0421 859 547 <tel:0421%20859%20547>

chris@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:chris@wolfiq.com.au>

On 26 Oct 2022, at 4:50 pm, Jenna Bongioletti <Jenna@allearsandspeech.com.au <mailto:Jenna@allearsandspeech.com.au>> wrote:

Hi Chris,
The resources page will ultimately be things you can download or print out and use with your child / client. I’m imagining a thumbnail image of the flier that you click and then download the resource / read the content.
Jenna

Sent: Wednesday, 26 October 2022 2:27 PM

Cc: Nicole Eglinton <nicole@allears.com.au <mailto:nicole@allears.com.au>>
Subject: Re: Two handouts for 'resources' page

Hi Jenna,

Ah, I see. I understood these as being downloadable info sheets.

The file that contains content is structured a little differently from the current page layout. Are you able to “chunk it up” for me so to speak?

It would be great to follow the question-and-answer format. If I am confusing things, perhaps we can jump on a call to go the info will be worthwhile.

Regards,

Jenna

Thanks and speak soon,
